page.title: 12Breedon Community Council
page.content: The Community Council has a major role in the life of Breedon and its' people. The council is made up of various people who want to help Breedon. The council was formed when the new school was built in 1963. The people wanted somewhere to meet and for recreational purposes as well as a new school. So a meeting resulted in the village and the County Council combining monies to build the school and a community centre. The Community Council fosters good relationships with all affilliated bodies who use the community centre. These affilliated groups all have representatives on the committee. The Community Council meet once a month. They arrange interesting events like dances, whist drives and other social activities for the local people.
